posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked:
I have this code…

Error I’m getting is “Can’t Convert GenericEntry to NetworkTableEntry” I’m new to programming the robot in Java this year but not new to programming or FRC. This simple code is used in all the examples I see online. The API does seem to indicate that this error is valid. getEntry does return a “GenericEntry” and that looks like it is an interface that NetworkTableEntry doesn’t implement. But again all the example code is set up like this so I don’t know what my disconnect is.

I’m on WPILIB 2023.4.1 and this code is in the initialization section of my Arm Subsystem class

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
Will get the job done.

The error message is telling you that the getEntry() method being called returns a type of GenericEntry and you’re trying to assign to something that is a NetworkTableEntry type.

The NetworkTables documentation shows how this can work.  Since it’s likely a copy/paste of prior code, you can also read the section about what has changed from NT3 → NT4.

link_counts.title: Publishing and Subscribing to a Topic — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked:
Thanks. So this is an issue of the update to NT4 and the examples posted in the FRC documentation not being updated yet? This is where I based my code from

Unlike SmartDashboard.getNumber and friends, retrieving data from Shuffleboard is also done through the NetworkTableEntries, which we covered in the previous article. Java class DriveBase extends S...

I’ll dive into the pages you recommended.

link_counts.title: Retrieving data — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
Sort of, there’s a separate page that shows you what I mean.

It would be better if there was some caveat to show people that the Shuffleboard documentation is NT3 not NT4.  Shuffleboard isn’t really maintained though, which is a big hurdle.

link_counts.title: Migrating from NetworkTables 3.0 to NetworkTables 4.0 — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked: So is it recommended to use SmartDashboard and not Shuffleboard, if Shuffleboard is not maintained? Again, new to robot JAVA this year so really trying to get a handle on best practices.

posts.name: NewtonCrosby
posts.cooked:
My opinion hat: If you’re not really interested in using the Layout as Code option, I don’t think there’s much to be gained from Shuffleboard vs. SmartDashboard.

I like Shuffleboard still because we try to build a pane for the drivers to see everything they need from code, so that’s what we use.  It’s not without gremlins though.

You could probably get to the same point with SmartDashboard and saved layouts, but we’ve never tried that so I don’t know for sure.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
AfterTen:

So this is an issue of the update to NT4 and the examples posted in the FRC documentation not being updated yet?

Whoops, we forgot to update the Shuffleboard docs, sorry about that.  Please open an issue on the frc-docs repo.

AfterTen:

So is it recommended to use SmartDashboard and not Shuffleboard, if Shuffleboard is not maintained?

Neither one has a lot of active maintenance, but there’s zero maintainence going into SmartDashboard (in fact, it’s still using NT3 on the client side), and at least some going into Shuffleboard.
